p: The significantly higher permittivity values of the 16.2 nm recycled Î±-Fe 2O 3 particles can be related to the larger specific surface area and interfacial density resulting in the improvement in interfacial polarization. Additionally, ferrites and other 3-d metal oxide nanoparticles are susceptible to oxygen vacancy formation at the interfacial layers which can greatly influence the magnetic [ 24] and dielectric [ 25] properties. Moreover, the compactness of the nanoparticles enabled air-gap-free contact with constituent particles which led to the enhancement of interfacial polarization and therefore complex permittivity.
